intro: Primulina cangwuensis, commonly known as the Cangwu primula, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in mountainous regions. Its foliage is usually dark green, and the flowers can be white, pink, or purple, depending on the variety. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
